subject: RE: [junit] JUnit Beginner
msgSnippet: ... There is a good book on unit testing and iirc it has some eclipse in it. iirc, junit in action.  but eclipse for the most part knows about junit. (I usuall
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: sgiri1981 [mailto:sgiri1981@...]
> Sent: Sunday, February 06, 2005 12:34 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnit Beginner
>
> I have been working on JAVA projects and now we want to do automated
> testing using JUnit. We will be working on Eclipse 3.0.1.
>
> For this task, can anyone suggest some reading material/best
> practices-- from a beginner's pt of view. ...

There is a good book on unit testing and iirc it has some eclipse in it.
iirc, junit in action. but eclipse for the most part knows about junit. (I
usuall just put a main in my test cases and run it as a normal program). The
important thing is to read the recipes book http://eagle/~rtayek/ second
(maybe first, I read them in the order that they came out).

thanks
